text:
Do you mean you are using UTF-8 context names, and they are not displayed 
correctly ?

Yes. ManagerServlet response is made by 
org/apache/catalina/servlets/LocalStrings_ja.properties, So charset should be 
UTF-8 or Shift_JIS or other Japanese encoding.
More better solutino is to select appropriate charset using like 
org.apache.catalina.CharsetMapper.
creator: kare@w4.dion.ne.jp

text:
Thanks for reporting this. I have committed a patch which makes sure
setContentType includes the localized charset.  It should be in the
next release of Tocmat 4.1.
